resources.string: The large chalk formations are impressive and unmissable, rising unexpectedly from the flat farmland surrounding them on all sides. They reach up to 70 ft in places and it is possible to see fossilized sea life embedded in the chalk.
Mushroom Rock, Mushroom Rock State Park
These strange formations are formed through uneven erosion and weathering, giving the rocks the appearance of mushrooms.
Though the falls remain mostly unknown to tourists, they are popular with locals for fishing, hiking and canoeing. The falls are 60 ft wide with a short 5 ft drop.
Drinkwater and Schriver Flour Mill, Cedar Point
This has been a Kansas landmark since 1875, when the stone building we see today was completed. Standing by a stone dam in the Cottonwood River, the mill was originally a sawmill.
63rd St and Brookside Blvd Kansas City, MO 64113
It is a resting area for millions of migrating birds, and home to many other types of animal including raccoons, beavers, turtles and snakes.
From renowned painter Thomas Hart Benton and Walt Disneyís first animation studio to the Hallmarkís headquarters and the Kansas City Art Institute

A renowned institution thatís been a staple in the community since the Great Depression, The Nelsonís collection contains artwork encompassing more than 5,000 years of history from all across the world. Plus, itís totally free.
Kauffman Center for the Performing Arts

Electric and engaging, eclectic and exceptional, Kansas City thrives on stage. Catch a live show at one of the many iconic venues around the metro, each with its own unique style and history. Witness some of the most celebrated performers at the iconic Kauffman Center for the Performing Arts, an architectural and cultural sensation
ALICE C. SABATINI ART GALLERY AT TOPEKA

From Topeka\'s earliest days, the library has provided a free artistic and cultural experience for the community. People of all ages find wonder and delight at the library\'s Alice C. Sabatini Gallery. For some, it is their first formal encounter with art.

The Combat Air Museum has on display 38 military aircraft, from WWI to the present day, in addition to multiple static displays of missiles, rockets, aircraft engines, artifacts and dioramas. Tour guides are usually available to interact with those guest who want a little extra information.
American, Vegetarian Friendly, Gluten Free Options
30 W Pershing Rd Ste 900, Kansas City, MO

Conveniently located near I-70 and Highway 291, this three-story, climate-controlled shopping mall features 117 retail shops. Purchase current fashions at PINK Victoria Secret or American Eagle Outfitters, and accessories from Claire\'s or Jared.

Shop dozens of name-brand stores and local favorites, at discounted prices, when you visit the Kansas City area\'s only designer outlet center. Current fashions abound from Saks Fifth Avenue OFF 5th, to J. Crew | Crewcuts, or F21 Red (Forever 21).

If you love one-of-a-kind, creative design, then the fun and funky Crossroads Arts District is a must-do shopping destination. Creative people have filled neighborhood galleries and studios with handcrafted ceramics to enormous oil paintings, and meticulously crafted jewelry
E 18th St and Grand Blvd Kansas City, MO 64108

lanned and built in the 1920s, Brookside remains one of Kansas City\'s favorite suburban shopping areas. Full of leafy trees, broad sidewalks and independently owned businesses, this neighborhood feels a bit like you\'re stepping back in time.
63rd St and Brookside Blvd Kansas City, MO 64113

Two open-air shopping areas with a common name are great places to browse the latest fashions at White House | Black Market, purchase upscale home essentials at Restoration Hardware or find premium athletic-wear at Lululemon Athletica.
